During the height of Thassilon's power, agents of Runelord Karzoug and Runelord Sorshen often called scarlet walkers to Golarion from Leng. Although these elephant-sized monstrosities largely despise other inhabitants of Leng, some swallow their pride to work alongside the [denizens of Leng](/Monsters.aspx?ID=604) or [Leng ghouls](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1165) in exchange for passage into the waking world. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Scarlet Walker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1943) **Source** [Shadows at Sundown](/Sources.aspx?ID=121) pg. 57 **Perception** +23; bloodsense 60 feet, [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 300 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +22, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +22, [Blood Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +26, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +23, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) +23, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** +6 **Dex** +7 **Con** +5 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +4 **Bloodsense** The scarlet walker can sense living creatures with blood in their veins, as well as [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) that feed on blood (such as [vampires](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=97)). --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +21 **Ref** +25 **Will** +21 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 225 **Immunities** cold **Resistances** [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) 10 **Weaknesses** [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 10 **Blood-Draining Gaze** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 20 feet. When a living, non–scarlet walker creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 29 Fortitude save to prevent thin streams of blood from streaming from its eyes and into the eyeless pits in the scarlet walker's face. On a failed save, the victim becomes [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (drained 2 on a critical failure) and [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) from the pain.
**No Breath** The scarlet walker doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an [inhaled](/Traits.aspx?ID=96) [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)). --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet; [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6) **Melee** claw +24 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d6+12 piercing plus 2d12 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Melee** tentacle +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+12 bludgeoning plus paralysis **Occult Innate Spells** DC 32 - **Cantrips (6th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61) - **4th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48) (×3) - **5th** [Mind Probe](/Spells.aspx?ID=193), [Sending](/Spells.aspx?ID=272) (×3), [Subconscious Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=314) - **6th** [Feeblemind](/Spells.aspx?ID=112), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344), [Vampiric Exsanguination](/Spells.aspx?ID=353) - **Constant (6th)** [Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6) **Eerie Flexibility** The scarlet walker can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. **Paralysis** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) Any living, non–scarlet walker creature hit by a scarlet walker's tentacle Strike must attempt a Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature is [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round, and is then [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for 1 round after recovering.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the paralysis doesn't automatically end after 1 round. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
Pools of Blood In the ragged valleys and badlands of their home plane, Leng, scarlet walkers build grisly cities of braided flesh and coagulated blood. There, they spend their days gathering and discussing the values and uses of all types of blood and meat. Some who have looked upon the roiling blood pools of Leng whisper of similarities to the _Everdawn Pool_ and wonder if these creations were the true inspirations for the infamous runewells of Thassilon.
